definition: rich and powerful family

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
surname Men
powerful individual, family or group/clique/(loanword) valve

sentences.english: The powerful family hereditary scholar class is in a landlord class's privileged stratum.
sentences.chinese: 門閥士族是地主階級中的一個特權階層。

sentences.english: The various expressions of this kind of marriage spoke of the decline of family power and its influence.
sentences.chinese: 南朝國婚士族種種表現反映了門閥士族的相對衰落。

sentences.english: The powerful family hereditary scholar class has the privilege and is maintaining with the commoners the strict boundary.
sentences.chinese: 門閥士族擁有特權並與庶族保持着嚴格界限。

sentences.english: This period is a historical period when the family of power and influence and the landlords dominated.
sentences.chinese: 魏晉南北朝是門閥地主占主導地位的歷史時期。

definition: Wei, Jin and North-South dynasties/generic term for historic period 220-589 between Han and Sui

to decide alone without consultation/arbitrary/dictatorial
